Client custom modules documentation¶

variables.py¶

The module contains global variables for the client application.

function.py¶

Module with function for send_message and get_message.

client.custom.function.get_message(client_server)¶

The function of receive messages from remote computers. Receives JSON messages, decode the received message and verifies that the dictionary is received.

Parameters

client_server (obj) – server socket.

client.custom.function.send_message(sock, message)¶

The function takes a message dictionary, serializes it in json and sends.

Parameters

  • sock (str) – transmission socket.

  • message (dict) – message to send.

decorators.py¶

The module contains decorators for the client application.

class client.custom.decorators.Log¶

Bases: object

A decorator that logs function calls. Saves events containing information about the name of the called function, the parameters with which the function is called, and the module that calls the function.

metaclass.py¶

Module with metaclass performing basic client check.

class client.custom.metaclass.ClientVerified(class_name, bases, class_dict)¶

Bases: type

A metaclass that performs basic client validation. Lack of accept and listen calls for sockets. Using sockets to work on TCP. Lack of creating sockets at the class level (class Client: s = socket()).

parse_args.py¶

The module contains functions for parsing startup parameters from the command line.

client.custom.parse_args.args_parser(*args)¶

Function for parsing arguments from the command line.

Parameters

args (tuple) – tuple with arguments for the parser.

Returns

object namespace with arguments.

client.custom.parse_args.check_address(address)¶

The function checks the correctness of the address.

Parameters

address (str) – server address.

Return bool

True if the address is correct, False if not.

client.custom.parse_args.check_port(port)¶

The function checks the port for correctness.

Parameters

port (int) – server port.

Return bool

True if the port is correct, False if not.

client.custom.parse_args.get_command_args(*args)¶

The function returns the IP address and port of the server if it was entered on the command line. The default is IP address 127.0.0.1, port 7777.

Parameters

args (tuple) – tuple with arguments for the parser.

Returns

object namespace with arguments.

errors.py¶

The module contains custom exceptions.

exception client.custom.errors.ServerError(text)¶

Bases: Exception

Class is an exception for handling server errors. During generation, it requires a string describing the error received from the server.

transport.py¶

The module describes the interaction with the server.

class client.custom.transport.ClientTransport(ip_address, port, database, username, password, keys)¶

Bases: threading.Thread, PyQt5.QtCore.QObject

Class - Transport, is responsible for interacting with the server.

add_contact_to_server(contact)¶

The method sends information about adding a contact to the server.

Parameters

contact (str) – username to add to your contact list.

connection_init(ip_address, port)¶

The method initiates a connection to the server.

Parameters

  • ip_address (str) – server IP-address.

  • port (int) – server port.

connection_loss¶

The slot handler is a loss of connection to the server. Gives a warning window and terminates the application.

create_message(recipient, message)¶

Method for sending a message to the server.

Parameters

  • recipient (obj) – socket object.

  • message (str) – message to the recipient.

get_contact_list_from_server()¶

The method requests a list of user contacts from the server.

Returns

user contact list.

get_key_from_server(username)¶

The method requests the public key from the server.

Parameters

username (str) – username.

get_registered_user_from_server()¶

The method requests from the server a list of registered users.

Returns

list of registered users.

message_205¶

Message slot 205 - a request by the server to update directories of available users and contacts. It may turn out that the current person is deleted, you need to check this and close the chat with a warning. Otherwise, just update the contact list without giving a warning to the user.

new_message¶

The slot handler of incoming messages, decrypts incoming messages and stores them in the message history. Asks the user if a message was received not from the current interlocutor. If necessary, change the interlocutor.

receive_message(message)¶

The function processes the server response.

Parameters

message (dict) – message from the server.

remove_contact_to_server(contact)¶

The function sends contact deletion information to the server. :param str contact: username to remove from the contact list.

run()¶

Method for starting the process of receiving messages from the server.

transport_shutdown()¶

The method of closing the connection, sends an exit message.

Messenger
